wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-General Sir Charles Craufurd Fraser  (31 August 1829 – 7 June 1895) was a British recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces. He was also a Conservative politician.

response: * Lieutenant-General Sir Charles Craufurd Fraser – VC recipient
